intro: Sisymbrium incanum, commonly known as hoary salsify, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features slender, branched stems that are often covered in a fine, whitish bloom, giving it a silvery appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a rough texture and a distinctive gray-green color. Sisymbrium incanum is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
